Claim: A vaccine monitoring site shows Covid vaccines cause miscarriages.
Rating: False claim. There were indeed miscarriages reported in these databases - they are unfortunately common events - but this does not mean the jab caused them.

Claim: A study shows the Covid vaccine accumulating in the ovaries.
Rating: This is false and misreads a study submitted to the Japanese regulator.

Claim: Covid caccines could attack the placenta.
Rating: There is no evidence to support this claim and now studies are emerging to help disprove it.

Claim: The European Union is now advising that pregnant women should not receive COVID-19 vaccines because of the risk of infertility and miscarriage.
A new study shows that a second dose of a COVID-19 vaccine decreases sperm count and after a third shot “it’s almost unrecoverable.”
"All males who have been vaccinated" against COVID-19 "are effectively sterile."
New England Journal of Medicine “proves” 80% miscarriage rate among vaccinated women; COVID-19 vaccines harm men’s and women’s fertility
"The EMA admits COVID-19 vaccination causes infertility"

Rating: False. There is no scientific evidence that COVID vaccines harm the fertility of women or men.
